title: CN Level 6 â€” Application Layer Protocols
concept: HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, email protocols (SMTP, POP3, IMAP) and basic behavior.

challenges.title: Q1: DNS Purpose
challenges.description: DNS (Domain Name System) is used to:
examples:
Options:
 a) Encrypt web traffic
 b) Map domain names to IP addresses
 c) Transfer email messages
 d) Compress image files on the web

challenges.title: Q2: HTTP Type
examples:
Options:
 a) Connectionless transport protocol
 b) Application layer request-response protocol
 c) Network layer routing protocol
 d) Data link layer framing protocol

challenges.title: Q3: HTTPS
examples:
Options:
 a) HTTP over SSL/TLS for encryption
 b) HTTP using UDP instead of TCP
 c) A replacement for DNS
 d) A protocol for sending emails only

challenges.title: Q4: Email Sending Protocol
challenges.description: Which protocol is most commonly used to send emails from a client to a mail server?
examples:
Options:
 a) SMTP
 b) POP3
 c) IMAP
 d) FTP

challenges.title: Q5: Email Retrieval
challenges.description: Which protocol is commonly used by a mail client to retrieve emails while keeping them stored on the server (synchronization across devices)?
examples:
Options:
 a) SMTP
 b) POP3
 c) IMAP
 d) DHCP
